name: Taking, injuring, or destroying wild birds prohibited
text: §183D-62  Taking, injuring, or destroying wild birds prohibited.  Except as provided in section 183D-61, no person shall intentionally, knowingly, or recklessly take, catch, injure, kill, or destroy, or attempt to take, catch, injure, kill, or destroy, any wild bird, or to keep or have possession of any wild bird, dead or alive, or to damage or destroy a nest of any wild bird. [L 1985, c 174, pt of §4]
